comment.body:
> [nippletwister](#comment_1_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf): What style are these pictures in? Some sort of abstractionism?

This example was a combination of a lot of effects in a graphics software. I think it began with a photo, which I saved in very low-quality jpg format. This resulted in this blocky structure. Subsequently a combination of blur and color-reduce was added a few times. The color reduce was rather drasticly - only admitting like 3 to 10 different colors. The color reduce was done with Floyd-Steinberg Dithering on to get these pixel-effects. The colors were done in the last round. 

Most of this image was done randomly, but again and again until something interesting came out. (untitled___3 has the same image but with different colors).

> [muja](#comment_1_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr): The image is not showing up. Is it just me?

I experimented with webp to reduce image file size.
What browser did you use that wasn't showing the images?

> [muja](#comment_3_17i7Y7r8nTaCfLbCAuaKyc4R5BbKZYU2Hr): Firefox and Tor.

Hm. Yes Firefox isn't working :(

> [danny](#comment_1_1gxnMbioXRbkebgK9JSmqkPhXRH97a6Jn): Reminds me of the Gameboy Camera

yes, maybe. I like this kind of 'aesthetic' 
There is also a very high-res (4096x4096 px) full color-version of this. I will propably post it sooner or later. maybe even the giant picture for people who want to print it).

> [grandchild](#comment_8_14dXYTMY7gArErE6jLYHBzb6c9uFDym8yZ): very "beyond the black rainbow"

Oh ja :)

> [redacted](#comment_1_19qsuxKBkNZWYft3epWgn6u3gG82sQHs6n): Did you make this in ready as well or is there some other procedural art package you're using?

This was done in blender only :-)
